BALTIMORE, MD., JUNE 12, 1922

VOL. XXVI. No 59
1922 SOUTHERN LACROSSE
CHAMPIONSHIP TO REMAIN UNDECIDED
Mt. Washington Contest Concludes Successful Season for Black and Blue.
Defeat of Oxford Features.

The lacrosse champion of the
United States will remain undecided for the seascn of 1922. It has
been found impractical to play off
the three-cornered tie existing in
the Southern Intercollegiate Lacrosse League between Johns Hopkins, Lehigh and Pennsylvania.
Syracuse again captured the title in
the Northern Division and was
scheduled to. meet the Southern
champion on June _3.
The hitch came when Pennsylvania defeated the Hopkins twelve

on the Upper Quadrangle, will be
an elaborate ground-breaking ceremony upon the site. of the Memorial Dormitory. George W.
Knapp, Jr., President of the
Alumni Association, recently announced a favorable bid had been
received and accepted, and that the
work would start upon the new
building. during the early part of

United States will remain undecided for the seascn of 1922. It has

the three-cornered tie existing in
the Southern Intercollegiate Lacrosse League between Johns Hopkins, Lehigh and Pennsylvania.

the Northern Division and was
scheduled to. meet the Southern
champion on June _3.
